884200668:
[

System Administrator

Company Name Energy and Water Ombudsman (Victoria) (EWOV) Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 108 views

Job description

  • Be a part of a leading not-for-profit servicing all of Victoria
  • Convenient CBD location
  • 12 month contract opportunity with the potential to become permanent


Who are we?

The Energy and Water Ombudsman (Victoria) (EWOV) is a not-for-profit, independent and impartial dispute resolution service. We provide Victorian energy and water customers with free, accessible, informal and fast dispute resolution. EWOV is one of the most respected and effective Ombudsman schemes in Australia. We take pride in building a culture centred around developing and nurturing our staff in order to provide the best possible service to our customers.


A little bit about the role

EWOV is seeking an experienced System Administrator to fill this newly created role. Working together with a busy, in-house IT Team of five and reporting to the Systems Infrastructure Manager, the role will be responsible for keeping EWOV’s systems running efficiently and effectively. As well as overseeing the administration of EWOV’s hardware and software and liaising with vendors, you will be exposed to exciting, upcoming projects.


The role requires:

  • \xa0The administration of EWOV’s hardware and software, including our operating systems, physical servers, virtual servers, telephony system, internet, extranet and all applications
  • Liaising with people and departments at all levels within EWOV to ensure effective service delivery
  • Regular operating and testing of EWOV’s disaster recovery program
  • Providing on-the-spot technical advice and recommendations for improvements
  • Managing the internal IT support ticketing system


About you

To be successful in this role you will have had previous experience in a similar role. You will be comfortable self-managing your own workload and have a flexible approach to balancing longer-term project goals with day-to-day needs. You will share your knowledge and experience to provide valued contributions to the team as well as be open to learning new things.


In addition you will have:

  • Hands-on experience with Windows AD, DNS, DHCP, Group Policy, VMware, MS Office and general application support
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
  • Excellent time management with the ability to assess, prioritise and complete set tasks on time and to EWOV's standards
  • Relevant tertiary qualification and/or professional certification


In return, you will be welcomed into a supportive team environment with on-the-job coaching and mentoring, as well as opportunities to further develop your skills and knowledge.


For any further information please view the position description at ewov.com.au/about/careers or contact the People and Development Team on 03 8672 4332 for a confidential discussion.

If you’d like to apply please email your cover letter and CV to ewov.confidential@ewov.com.au by midnight Sunday 14th October 2018.

\xa0

Job description

MACPHERSON KELLEY

Macpherson Kelley is a hands-on commercial law firm, known for our business mindset, client service, innovation and investment in great relationships. With offices across Victoria, New South Wales and Queensland and a formal company structure, we offer you the opportunity to build your career in the real business world.

It is our goal for our clients, and our people, to be our strongest advocates.

OPPORTUNITY

An opportunity has arisen for a commercial lawyer with 3+ years post-admission experience to join our highly experienced Melbourne Commercial team. This role will provide you with broad work exposure across a number of industries with some of our highly valued clients. Day to day you will be working on business and share sales and acquisitions, shareholder agreements as well as a small amount of property leasing.

You will be given the opportunity to mentor and oversee the work of the junior lawyers in the team.

This is an excellent opportunity for a lawyer who enjoys direct client contact, looking to work alongside talented senior practitioners who are keen to share their knowledge and advance their career.

ABOUT YOU

To date you have gained strong business buy/sell transactional experience as well exposure to a wide range of commercial contract drafting and advisory work. You have built a strong knowledge of the Corporations Act. Experience with business structuring and property leasing is a bonus. You are driven and ambitious and keen to roll up your sleeves to progress your career.

  • at least 3 years post-admission experience in general commercial law
  • strong client engagement skills
  • a commercial mindset
  • proven ability to work autonomously as well as part of a team
  • strong file management and financial management skills
  • a good sense of humour and positive attitude

THE EXTRAS

There are many benefits that we offer to support our flexible, innovative and positive work environment. There are purchase leave options as well as recognition and performance bonus schemes. We also offer social, wellness, sporting and community based activities. We are proud to offer genuine flexibility through our Flex+ program.

Your development in this role is a key priority for us. The Macpherson Kelley Business School provides tailored development for different levels of experience, including commercial Bootcamps for new lawyers through to Masterclasses for Principals.

884550473:
[

Real Estate - Occupier Advisory Consultant / Senior Consultant

Company Name Deloitte Australia Company Location Melbourne CBD, Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 37 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


Deloitte Real Estate Advisory helps clients take a strategic approach to property. Do you have a passion for solving the most complex problems for the most iconic clients in the Australian market? We are seeking a Consultant or Senior Consultant to join our Occupier Advisory team. With your innovative ideas and our real estate industry experience, we will take your career to the next level. Your clients will include domestic and global public and private sector organisations.

About the Opportunity
Our market position and strong growth have created the need for more talented professionals to join our team. We have a unique opportunity that transcends traditional property roles and extends to cover a variety of complex consultancy instructions by working with occupiers seeking to extract value from mainly leased property.

This role will provide the platform to accelerate your career in the real estate market, gain diverse skills and the opportunity to learn from industry experts on a range of challenging and exciting projects. We will provide you with the guidance and tools to build your personal portfolio of skills to a world-class level, with access to the global Deloitte network of thought leadership, methodologies, trends and subject matter experts.

You will be responsible for:

  • Helping to understand how an organisation uses its corporate real estate (mainly leased) and translating corporate objectives into real estate requirements
  • Conducting research to support benchmarking activities or other analysis, inclusive of real estate-related data and business data
  • Undertaking quantitative and qualitative analysis
  • Identifying and applying the appropriate framework and methodology to solve problems
  • Preparing foundational correspondence and deliverables including reports and presentations
  • Growing and building new long-term relationships within the real estate industry and internally within Deloitte
  • Delivering a high quality of client service and assistance on the day-to-day tasks required on a range of projects.



About You
Ideally you will be able to demonstrate:

  • As a Consultant, at least 12 months experience in a management consultancy, business analyst, professional services, or real estate advisory role with an interest in pursuing a career in real estate
  • As a Senior Consultant, at least two years' experience in real estate advisory or, alternatively, three years in a management consultancy, business analyst, professional services, or advisory role
  • A professional qualification in business, property, or another field you feel will qualify you for the opportunity
  • Highly motivated with a desire to step into, or further your existing position in, a relatively niche field in the property industry
  • Advanced research and analytical skills, particularly identifying and applying a toolkit of methodologies and frameworks to solve problems
  • The ability to source information for benchmarking, valuation or business case from a variety of industry sources
  • Coherent and concise business writing and presentation skills
  • An innovative thinker in both team and independent environments.



You will be working in a supportive environment where career development and promotion is based on merit, not years of service, with counselling managers who will assist you with career planning and objective setting.

About Us: Deloitte Culture
From day one at our firm you'll be considered part of the Deloitte community and our development and career progression framework will help you develop the skills and capabilities you need to succeed - in every sense of the word. At Deloitte, we assume that you perform other roles within your life….you could be a student, a teacher, a passionate hobbyist and a caring family member. We recognise the importance of balance and embrace agility, understanding that this means different things to each and every one of our employees.

Next Steps
If you have any questions regarding this role you can contact Juliette Jamoneau in the Talent Acquisition Team via the Our Recruiters section.

884665219:
[

Senior Solutions Engineer

Company Name Nitro, Inc. Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 16 hours ago Number of views 18 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Who we are:

\xa0

Nitro is an exciting, high-growth company in the rapidly evolving digital documents space. We put people at the center of everything we do, both our customers and our employees.

\xa0

It comes back to one of our core values:

  • High Performance - We have a “performance first” orientation and ambitious plans for the company. This means ample opportunity for those who join us to make a big impact. Non-high performers need not apply.
  • Be Good - We hire people with big hearts and foster an environment where they can be themselves and do their best work. We celebrate individuality and diversity and provide our employees with the opportunities, the resources and the support they need to thrive and flourish.
  • No BS – this one is self-explanatory

\xa0

Our value proposition is straightforward, tangible and easy to prove: We believe software technology should be easy to use, help make people better, and be accessible to any knowledge worker who wants to be more productive.

\xa0

We are on a mission: we hire creative, intelligent, talented people; we build great products that delight our customers; and we are doing it in a rewarding way– a way that feels good and makes us proud to be part of Nitro.

\xa0

The Role:

\xa0

We are looking for a Senior Solutions Engineer to join our Sales team driving and retaining business in our APAC region. We are winning new business. As a key member of the team, you will drive all technical pre-sales motions including the Nitro Pilot. You will be responsible for ensuring successful deployments, troubleshooting issues, ensure successful roll-out and adoption and working to make our customer’s more productive. Only high performers should read the rest of the job description.

\xa0

In this role, you will report to the VP of Customer Success & Solutions team be the voice of our customers externally and internally. Working across many large enterprise customers, you will make an impact everyday. \xa0 You will have excellent customer acumen as you will be positioning and giving technical presentations to C-Suite and senior executives.

\xa0

We build long lasting customer relationships and you must thrive in this kind of environment. \xa0 You will understand customer’s current landscape and future requirements. Internally to Nitro, you are the champion of your customers and will work closely with multiple internal teams. You will work closely with our pre-sales, Customer Success, and Customer Support teams

\xa0

\xa0

What you’ll be doing:

\xa0

  • Working closely with our APAC Sales Team, you will provide technical leadership for our prospects and customer's initiatives. This includes driving successful Pilot evaluations, product training, solutions consulting, driving adoption and root cause problem solving and troubleshooting.
  • Manage and drive multiple requests across simultaneous prospects & customer deployments
  • Coordinate between cross-functional internal teams as well as our customer’s organizations
  • Provide clear and constructive product feedback to Nitro product management teams based on customer requirements
  • Prepare and deliver custom tailored demos as needed and demonstrate real thought leadership
  • Handle customer calls with empathy and respond professionally to technical / product questions. We are the best at what we do.
  • You will drive and follow-up on any issues raised to ensure timely closure and communications. This drive is critical for our success rate.
  • Drive yourself to maintain current functional and technical knowledge of the entire Nitro product line
  • Maintain curiosity and anticipate future trends, competitive landscape, understand how organizations work today and will work in the future
  • Work very closely with our Technical Support team on refining escalation processes, knowledge base, and work collaboratively to create an environment of cross learning

\xa0

Required Skills:

  • Ability to work independently and take direction.
  • Bachelor’s degree in IT, CS, or other related field and 7+ years IT experience
  • Minimum 5+ years of experience with enterprise software solutions as a sales
  • Ability to travel ~25%
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Server and Operating systems: 2008R2, 2012, Terminal server
  • Understanding of Application deployment in VDI: Terminal Server, Citrix XenDesktop, Citrix XenApp, VMWare Horizon, or AppV
  • Understanding of application installation methods on Windows Operating system, 7,8,10
  • Knowledge of enterprise environments, deployments and multi-system integrations
  • Communications and interpersonal skills, including ability to interact and communicate with customer senior management.
  • Demonstrated ability in customer-facing positions, preferably as a professional services consultant, solutions engineer, or sales engineer
  • Strong organizational skills with an ability to juggle multiple customers in a single working day
  • Experience working with complex to IT organizations
  • Articulating complex technical and business solutions simply to an executive audience
  • Superb presentation skills
  • A Plus - experience working with in document productivity applications, PDF, managed print services, or document management systems (DMS)
  • A Big plus – you like to tinker and build POCs

\xa0

\xa0

About Nitro:

\xa0

Nitro is changing the way the world works with documents. As the global leader in document productivity solutions, Nitro enables people to work smarter every day with their documents, on the desktop and in the cloud. From PDF creation, conversion, editing and reviewing capabilities, to cloud-enabled workflows for secure sharing, collaboration and electronic signatures, Nitro offers best-in-class solutions that every knowledge worker in an organization should use to improve productivity, document security and corporate sustainability.

\xa0

Founded in 2005, Nitro’s enterprise-grade solutions are now trusted by more than 650,000 leading businesses worldwide, including over half of the Fortune 500. One of the fastest-growing private companies in the world, Nitro is also a multiple Inc. 500/5000, BRW Fast 100, Deloitte Technology Fast 50, and Software 500 award winner. Headquartered in San Francisco, Nitro also has offices in Dublin, Ireland Melbourne, Australia and London, UK.

\xa0

With a number of exciting generational projects on the books, we are growing our project management team and are currently looking for a senior project controls professional with demonstrated capability in the art of establishing and managing project services functions on behalf of external and internal clients.

Risk Manager

Company Name Lander & Rogers Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 8 hours ago Number of views 26 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Lander & Rogers is a leading independent Australian law firm operating nationally from Melbourne, Sydney and Brisbane.\xa0 We are proud to be the trusted advisor to many publicly listed and private Australian companies, Australian subsidiaries of global companies as well as all levels of government.\xa0

We have nearly 500 staff nationally, seven broad areas of practice, and we cover a range of industry sectors, with a focus on financial services, insurance, government, infrastructure, real estate and retail and supply chain.

Our firm believes that legal services are much more than just the law - they are about great people, sustained excellence and exceptional client service. We have a reputation in the legal market as a provider of premium legal services, and as a sought-after employer. We are renowned in Australia for our down-to-earth and friendly workplace culture.

ABOUT THE ROLE

We have a unique and diverse opportunity for a legally qualified Risk Manager to manage and maintain the firm’s legal excellence and risk management framework. This opportunity is unique in that you will utilise your legal skills in relation to claims management, whilst experiencing diversity and breadth through the business risk management responsibilities.

Your key responsibilities will include:

  • Managing firm complaints and claims.
  • Managing all Information Barrier matters.
  • Ensuring the firm is complying with best practices in relation to Business Continuity, Disaster recovery and risk policies and procedures.
  • Proactive delivery of a strong risk and ethics education program for all staff firm-wide.
  • Creating and maintaining various compliance training registers and also any other registers required to be maintained by law.
  • Continually identifying, and mitigating new and existing firm risks, and developing solutions as part of our risk framework.
  • Working closely with the Ethics & Risk Management Committee to ensure effective communication and consistency of approach in the implementation of risk management initiatives throughout the firm.

ABOUT YOU

This opportunity would suit an individual who is happy to get involved in the daily management of the risk function, and can juggle this with the continuous improvement to ensure that the firm's risk management framework follows best practice. This will be a busy role with multiple competing priorities, therefore strong organisational skills as well as the ability to manage expectations is paramount. Good people and communication skills are a must have. A current practising certificate is essential as is experience in managing claims. If you have had experience in a similar role or performing parts of this role, we would be pleased to have a conversation with you.

This role presents an excellent opportunity to join a successful and growing firm with a down to earth and unique culture, with the ability to own and put your mark on the risk management function.

If you are interested, please submit your resume to Daniela Brown, People & Development Manager.

For more information about Lander & Rogers please see our website,\xa0www.landers.com.au.

Manager - Business Advisory (Private Clients)

Company Name BlueRock Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 62 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The BlueRock crew are currently looking for a super savvy Business Services Manager to join our growing business advisory team. Are you passionate about business & entrepreneurship and keen to work with some of Australia’s most innovative starts-up and entrepreneurs? This opportunity provides the lucky candidate to work with some of the most talented individuals in the industry within an entrepreneurial advisory firm!

\xa0

Who are we?

BlueRock is an entrepreneurial advisory firm with expertise across every aspect of business and private wealth. Whether it’s financing a start-up, building a website, creating a lease, planning a wealth creation strategy or all of the above, our whole team works together to get exceptional outcomes. Plus we have a heap of fun along the way!

  • Voted 4th Best Place to Work in Australia (between 100 and 999 employees category)
  • A certified B-Corporation company on a mission to use the power of business to solve social and environmental problems
  • A rapidly growing firm focused on community and becoming a social enterprise
  • An inclusive and diverse workplace culture centred on health and wellbeing through sports comps, free lunches, firm-wide personal development, retreats and Friday Festivus!

\xa0

What do we do?

BlueRock Australia is a Business advisory division embedded within an entrepreneurial advisory firm – and this sets us apart from the rest. We work holistically with every client to create an approach that suits every business, leaning on the skills and experience of the broader BlueRock community to add value and expertise.

We’re a rapidly growing team on the look-out for Melbourne’s best Accountants to join us through this exciting period of growth. In fact, our mission is to build a highly integrated community of exceptional minds who can work together to challenge industry norms.

From start-ups to established, e-commerce to lead gen, construction to hospitality, no day is ever the same. It’s fast paced but fun and you’re guaranteed to learn loads along the way.

Who are we looking for?

You’re a commercially-minded and experienced Manager within Tax/Business Services. You enjoy an autonomous environment with a formidable team culture. You’re analytical, results-driven and have a high attention to detail. You are someone who demonstrates honesty and integrity and always looks at ways to go the extra mile or solve that pesky problem.

What will you be doing?

  • Manage a team of up to 5/6 accountants (from Grad to Senior Accountant level)
  • Preparing financial statements and income tax returns for private clients
  • Reviewing taxation notices and preparing correspondence on behalf of clients;
  • Coaching, mentoring, managing workflow & helping with development of junior staff
  • Liaising with various providers and statutory authorities on behalf of clients;
  • Assist the Director with advisory/consulting engagements as and when required. Typically about 60-70% of your work will be in the consulting space - engagements include but not limited to cash flow forecasting, Business acquisition/sale, specialist tax advice etc
  • Identify opportunities and client requirements for financial planning services and referrals to other divisions of Blue Rock
  • Liaising with clients and on occasion working from client premises if required and appropriate

Show us what you’re made of! We want to hear from people who are:

  • You’re an experienced tax/business services Manager with a passion for delivering exceptional client service and seeing others succeed (6 to 10 years experience)
  • Degree qualified and hold a CPA/CA;
  • You’re a genuine collaborator with the ability to implement the big picture;
  • You know where to look to diagnose pain points and make them obsolete;
  • You’re as comfortable motivating others to succeed as you are with your head in a spreadsheet;
  • You care about the work you produce and take care to make sure it’s right;
  • You aren’t afraid to take risks in the name of innovation;
  • Compliance/advisory split is typically 30/70%. You will be expected to attend with the Director and eventually lead Monthly board meetings on behalf of and with clients, so a strong commercial acumen is essential
  • You are a pro when it comes to Xero;
  • Analytical background with a proven record of identifying and prioritising opportunities for improvement;
  • Effective communication skills to develop and foster key strategic relationships with internal and external parties and to better identify and understand client needs;
  • Excellent time management skills allowing deadlines to be met and the highest client service standards maintained;
  • At the end of the day… you get shit done!

\xa0

Even though it's 2018, it still needs to be said:
We don't just accept diversity at BlueRock, we celebrate it. We're proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an employer of choice. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of age, citizenship, colour, disability, gender and gender identity, marital status, nationality, race, sexual orientation or veteran status.
\xa0

Recruitment Agencies:
Please be advised that BlueRock or any of its related or controlled entities do not accept unsolicited resumes from Recruitment Agencies. BlueRock will not recognise an entitlement to an introduction or placement fee unless the Agency has been briefed by a member of the Performance & Culture team on a specific position for which we have requested candidates for. We are not currently considering additions to our list of preferred suppliers.

\xa0

\xa0

884540025:
[

Senior Payroll Officer

Company Name Medibank Company Location 720 Bourke Street Docklands Melbourne, Victoria, VIC 3008, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 46 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

At Medibank we stand for better health for better lives.


We are Medibank – an integrated healthcare company providing private health insurance and health solutions to 3.7 million Australians.


About Us


We're passionate about nurturing careers.


We support new innovation and thinking, and openly collaborate and share new ideas. We're healthy and active in our lives and wellbeing is encouraged at every level. Our people play an important role in the future of health and healthcare and we believe that working together, we're stronger.


The Opportunity

\xa0

As our Senior Payroll Officer within the Medibank People Services team you will be responsible for processing of all manual and automated payments to staff while ensuring compliance with all related legislation.


In this role, you will also be researching issues and developing recommendations to resolve employee and management payroll issues. With your proactive approach to situations, you will be able to foresee alternative solutions to any potential challenges.


Key responsibilities will include:


  • Ensuring salaries and wages are distributed accurately and on time as per EBA, Award, Employment Contracts and other legislative requirements.
  • Interpreting awards/agreement/contracts.\xa0
  • Ensuring all timesheets, payroll changes, records and other related material is received prior to the close of payroll run.\xa0\xa0
  • Preparing, balancing, processing and reconciling the following: payroll tax, PAYG tax, superannuation, and payment summaries.
  • Preparing management reports based upon information within the payroll system.
  • Undertaking required statutory reporting.\xa0
  • Resolving/answering queries relating to payroll across the company


About You

\xa0

To be successful in this role, you will have vast experience with human resource information systems and computerized payroll system including SAP. You will have the ability to present complex information in an easy to understand multifaceted situations.

\xa0

With your attention to detail and service focus, you will be able to assist in delivering a strong and proactive payroll function.


What We Offer


In return for your hard work we offer a range of great benefits. Furthermore, we take the health and wellbeing of our employees seriously, offering flexible working conditions and encouraging wellbeing at all levels of life.


Medibank is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application to assist you through the recruitment process.


A Career at Medibank adds up to more. More achievement. More progress. More passion and more innovation for health.


For a career option that will suit you better, click to apply.


For a confidential discussion, please email Denika.Mitkov@medibank.com.au

884054141:
[

OPSM Store Manager - Brimbank

Company Name OPSM Company Location Deer Park, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 8 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

At OPSM we are passionate about opening eyes to the unseen. As a leading eye care and eyewear retailer, we have been looking after the eyes of Australians and New Zealanders for over 80 years. We are not your typical retail business. We are obsessed with eye care and offering our customers the confidence in how they see the world.

We are part of Luxottica Group, a global eyewear company with over 7,000 retail stores across 130 countries and brands like Ray Ban, Oakley, Prada and Burberry to name a few. Working with us means you are part of something bigger.

In this Store Manager role based in our Brimbank store you will lead a motivated and passionate team of experienced optical professionals in deliver world class customer service in identifying how OPSM can help to maximise customers’ lifestyle enjoyment factor with appropriate eyewear and eye care, including sunglasses, lenses, frames and accessories.

As an effective leader you will engage and influence the team by coaching, developing and inspiring them to be their best. You will also explore ways to further advance your store’s performance and be accountable for outstanding success. Essential in delivering on this target will be ensuring corporate initiatives and standards are met in terms of visual merchandising, stock management and best practice.

Your success will build on the foundation of previous store management experience with excellent leadership and people skills, and an unwavering passion for exceptional customer service. You will be self-motivated with the ability to inspire your team to achieve great results, and have fun along the way! Essential to our business, you must be curious and willing to learn optical concepts and develop the competence in your team, and have the drive to maximise sales and profit potential supported by an astute understanding of budget, P&L and KPIs.

At OPSM we can offer you an opportunity to make a real difference in the way people see the world. You will be able to access an industry leading training curriculum and support to ensure a smooth transition into the world of eye care, and diverse career pathways to pursue your career goals wherever that may be. We offer competitive salaries and incentives to recognise your contribution, a generous product allowance for you to enjoy wearing our premium brands and other benefits too. You will also have the opportunity to join our mission to help the world see by participating in our OneSight outreach program.

If you are a likeminded individual who truly cares for our customers, click apply and complete our quick and simple questionnaire to see if our values align.

Job description

Community Engagement Advisor – Expression of Interest
  • Global leader in water solutions
  • Water and wastewater networks projects
  • Based in South East Suburbs of Melbourne
Veolia Water Technologies, a division of Veolia Water and Veolia Environnement, is a world leader in water treatment, with 6,100 employees through 120 business units. We are a leader in engineering, design, project management and execution of construction projects for turnkey facilities and water treatment plants.

Expressions of Interest are invited for Community Engagement Advisors who are interested in learning more about our business and the opportunities we offer. The Community Engagement Advisor will be responsible for successfully managing communications and community engagement activities across projects and for building effective relationships with clients and all other key stakeholders.

What The Role Looks Like
  • Develop and deliver stakeholder / community engagement plans and communications in relation to the project
  • Represent the organization at various community based forums and build relationships with the Client, and other relevant stakeholders
  • Manage and resolve customer issues, enquiries and complaints
  • Develop internal and external communications in relation to the project
  • Work with the teams to develop the business and recommend improvement opportunities
  • Working effectively with the group Tendering, Project Management, National BD team and Support areas functions
  • Support managers, engineers and work crews in valuing community and stakeholder engagement to improve business outcomes
What We Are Looking For
  • 2-3 years of experience in managing Community Relations
  • Experience within the water industry is a must, in particular within water and sewer networks replacement works
  • Experience working in projects for Water Authorities within Melbourne Metropolitan
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Strong customer focus with the ability to think “outside-the-box”
  • Ability to multi task and meet deadlines
  • Strong computer skills
  • Current driver’s license
  • The right to permanently work in Australia.
Applications close on Monday 08 October 2018. The selected candidate will be required to pass a pre-employment medical. No recruitment agencies please.

Job description

About the role


The position is responsible for providing legal advice and support for the development and delivery of effective legal and commercial strategies and advice to Rail Projects Victoria for the procurement of works for the Regional Rail Revival (RRR) program. The role will include liaising and negotiating with stakeholders and the management of specific legal aspects of RRR projects in close association with project teams. The role will involve considerable interaction with other Government departments and agencies, including in relation to the implementation of project specific legal processes.


How to apply


Please include a Cover Letter, CV and response to Key Selection Criteria. We want to know why you want to work at the RPV, why you are interested in the role, and, taking into account the Key Selection Criteria as a whole, how your skills, knowledge, experience and qualifications are applicable to the role.

For a confidential discussion, please contact Julia Grbac - Senior HR Advisor on (03)\xa0 9027 5796


Applications close 11.59 pm - Sunday the 7th October 2018
